intro: Ornithidium serrulatum, commonly known as the serrated feather moss, is a member of the family Dicranaceae and is characterized by its delicate, feathery appearance. It is a small, evergreen moss that thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in forest understories. The plant has a dense, compact growth habit with elongated, narrow leaves that are often recurved at the edges. Its spore-producing structures, called sporophytes, are borne on short stalks and are typically reddish in color. Ornithidium serrulatum plays an important ecological role in soil stabilization and moisture retention in its native habitats.
